item.title: Dolphin morbillivirus
item.description: In this projecct we were interested in modeling a recent outbreak of dolphin morbillivirus amongst coastal bottlenose dolphins along the US East Coast. In collaboration with NOAA we adapted a spatial clustering framework from the seismology literature to infer previously unquantified epidemiological parameters such as the infectious period and reproduction number of the virus.
